intro: Crantzia pseudocordata, commonly known as the narrowleaf crantzia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in summer. Crantzia pseudocordata is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along streambanks.
